resources.string: Select a sorting algorithm to display a quick description about it!

Bubble sort repeatedly compares adjacent elements and swaps them if they are in the wrong order. It continues this process until the list is sorted. While simple, it\'s inefficient for large datasets.

Quick sort selects a \'pivot\' element, partitions the array into elements smaller and larger than the pivot, and recursively sorts the partitions. It\'s highly efficient on average, but can be slow in its worst-case scenario.
